rdf Package¶

rdf Package¶

Serves as some kind of a facade for the ‘rdflib’ library. In addition to just forwarding rdf operations to the library, the rdf module also maintains some useful directories and registers; this allows to, say, have rdf graphs looked up by their identifier, using the function get_graph() or have the namespaces module download all namespaces for a certain graph by calling import_ns().

kathaireo.rdf.bind_ns(g, name, url)¶

Create new namespace binding.

kathaireo.rdf.create_graph(name, store='default')[source]¶

Returns a new .rdflib.Graph instance with the given identifier, if said identifier has not already been given to an existing graph.

kathaireo.rdf.expand_term(token)¶

Un-shorten url.

kathaireo.rdf.extract_ns_terms(g)¶

Collects terms from graph rdf and assigns them to the namespaces they come from.

kathaireo.rdf.find_term(term, nsp=None, g=None)¶

Shows triple containing given term.

kathaireo.rdf.get_graph(name)[source]¶

Returns the graph identified by the given name, or None if no such graph is available.

kathaireo.rdf.graph_info(name, attr)[source]¶

Show info about specified graph. Info is available about: size, namespaces, ...

kathaireo.rdf.graph_name(g)[source]¶

Return graph identifier or ‘-‘.

kathaireo.rdf.import_ns(g)[source]¶

Downloads definitions of namespaces used in the rdf specified graph. This is done by function namespaces.provide_for().

kathaireo.rdf.load_resource(location, name=None)[source]¶

Loads rdf graph at location (file/url) and names it. Reuses (overwrites?) an existing graph if one going by the given name is known, creates a new instance if not. Returns whatever graph instance the resource in question is being read into. If parsing fails, a new attempt is made using another mimetype (remote.mimetypes). If location does not seem to point to a local file, an attempt is made to start a download from that location via remote.parse(). If everything fails, None is returned.

kathaireo.rdf.ls_rdf(g=None)¶

Returns rdf content of graph line by line as tuples.

kathaireo.rdf.repr_graph(g)[source]¶

Returns a string representation of given graph indicating name and storage mode.

kathaireo.rdf.save_xml(g, filename)[source]¶

Dumps rdf/xml to file. If no graphname parameter is passed, try to use current_graph instead.

kathaireo.rdf.set_graph(g)[source]¶

Sets the given rdf graph as the current default. When set, that graph will be the one operated on in interactive mode. This should cause input in which a <graphname> value is omitted to work on said current default. :param g: new default graph. May be None. :returns: status message.

kathaireo.rdf.shorten_url(url)¶

Shortens a given url by collapsing it to a pair of identifiers denoting namespace and term, like rdfs:label.

kathaireo.rdf.store_sqlite(name, filename)[source]¶

Store. Sqlite. database. Uses the storage module. Overwites graph referenced by name.

kathaireo.rdf.struct_uri(u)¶

kathaireo.rdf.namespaces.provide_for(ontology)[source]¶

Imports definitions of namespaces a given graph is using.

kathaireo.rdf.namespaces.reg_graph(g)¶

Copies a graph’s collection of namespaces to the :mod”.namespaces module, so that all namespaces bound by loaded graphs are stored at a common location.

remote Module¶

This module tries to download rdf contents from places remote from the hard disk of the machine we’re running on.

kathaireo.rdf.remote.is_internet_available()¶

Tries to establish socket towards google dns server.

kathaireo.rdf.remote.mimetypes = ['application/rdf+xml', 'text/n3', 'text/turtle', 'application/n-triples', 'application/x-trig', 'text/owl-functional']¶

List of mimetypes used for parsing of resources whose rdf format can’t be detected automatically.

kathaireo.rdf.remote.parse(g, location, format=None, guesses=['application/rdf+xml', 'text/n3', 'text/turtle'])[source]¶

Attempts to parse an RDF resource at a certain location by first downloading and then parsing it offline. Choice of parsing implementation depends on format parameter; By default, source format autodetection is applied, followed by a few attempts on forcing specific format parsers to process the source, determined by frequent mimetypes listed in mimetypes.

Whilst this behaviour will handle RDF sources reliably in most cases, the episode of wild guessing beginning whenever autodetection fails can cause a serious delay. Passing guesses=None mitigates this inefficiency, but possibly with the downside of parsing failure at common RDF expression formats.

Parameters:
  • g – Graph to write content to
  • location – URL of remote RDF source.
  • format – string identifying a specific format which the resource is expected to express its RDF contents in. Default is None, getting the parser to autodetect the source’s format, which goes well in most cases. If autodetection is likely to err, one can pass a mimetype like those in mimetypes, but no promise can be made that a correct format parameter will lead to parsing success.
  • guesses – List of mimetypes used for wild guessing of the input format in case autodetection fails. Set to None in order to trade time for chance.

storage Module¶

kathaireo.rdf.storage.save_xml(g, filename, format='pretty-xml')[source]¶

Note: format must be pretty-xml, because xml omits triples!

kathaireo.rdf.storage.sqlite(filename)[source]¶

Assigns an sqlite databse resource for an rdf graph as a persistent store. Will overwrite? existing graph.
